noun.description: An Austro-Asiatic language of the North Munda group, spoken principally in Jharkhand state in eastern India.

adjective.description: Of, relating to, or designating Mundari or its speakers.

origin: Late 19th century; earliest use found in Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal. Probably from Oriya or Bengali Muṇḍārī the Mundari language from Mundari Muṇḍā + -r-, Oriya or Bengali derivational suffix + -ī, feminine suffix forming language names.
